text: Tomasz Brożyna (born 19 September 1970 in Bieliny) is a Polish former professional road racing cyclist, who currently works as a directeur sportif for UCI Continental team . He entered professional cycling in 1996 and retired in 2006 at the age of 36. He is the first Polish cyclist to complete all three of the Grand Tours. Brożyna was a member of the Korona Kielce (1986–1995), Rotan Spiessens (1995), (1996–1997), (1998–1999, 2004, and 2006), (2000–2002), (2003), and Knauf teams (2005).
